title: Are humans born with knowledge? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends how you define knowledge? We know to suckle, to breath, to cry when we need something, to be curious, to be afraid of the dark, to defecate, to be wary of creepy/slithery things…🤔

Innate information may be accepted as a type of “knowledge”. But this is basic information needed for the lifeform to survive. This innate information is quite a problem for the evolutionists to explain.
No, knowledge comes from the environment one is born into, If we are born into a poorly educated environment, it wold take very favourable conditions for a child to want to learn and gain knowledge

No. Being, eliminates the function of the concept, knowing. without utilizing, the utility isn't. It's only after being is no longer experienced due to the interference of others, That knowledge arises.
